columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to determine if the following statements are true or false.

## a.

We will expect the pound to appreciate relative to the dollar if the general price index in Great Britain is faster than the general price index in United States.

**General Price Index** is the average change of price of goods in a specific location for a certain period. If the general price index in Great Britain is faster than the general price index in United States, this means the purchasing power of pounds is lesser. Therefore, **more pounds** are required to purchase a dollar.

If more pounds are required to purchase a dollar, the pound will depreciate instead of appreciate.
\
Therefore, the statement is **false**.

## b.

The invoices of all the sales are in foreign currency. Furthermore, Euroland monetary authorities begin to undertake an expansionary monetary policy. 
\
Therefore, it is certain that the policy will result to an increase in inflation rate in Europe than other countries. The use of forward market is a must to protect yourself from future losses due to the decrease of the value of euros.
**Forward market**  or forward trade is an *agreement to exchange currency* for a certain time period. The *exchange rate agreed* to be used in the future is called the **forward exchange rate.**

Although forward markets can be used as a protection for the incoming invoices when the value of euros is till high, it **cannot prevent** the deterioration of euros due to the policy implemented. You can use forward markets for transactions during the current period. However, for future periods, the forward contract will use the value of euros that have been depreciated already. Hence, *you will still have future losses.*

As a result, the use forward market cannot be use to protect yourself from future losses due to the decrease of the values of euros.

Therefore, the statement is **false**.

## c.

You could successfully speculate in spot currency market if you could accurately estimate the differences in the relative inflation rates of two countries over a long period of time when other cannot do so.
A **spot trade** happens when there is an agreement to trade currencies based on the *exchange rate on that day* that must be settled within two business days.

Moreover, the **relative purchasing parity** tells us the *change in exchange rate* over a period of time. The higher the inflation rate, the lower purchasing power the country has which will result to a decrease in its currency value. On the other, if the inflation rate is low, the purchasing power of the country is high which will result to an increase it its currency value. Relative purchasing parity shows the *inverse relationship* of inflation rate to the currency value.

If one can accurately accurately estimate the differences in the relative inflation rates of two countries, he can determine when is the inflation rate low so that the value of the currency he will be trading is higher. As a result, he can successfully speculate spot currency markets.

Therefore, the statement is **true**.

As a conclusion, we have determined which of the following statements are true or false.
\
**Statement a and b are false while statement c is true.**
